p: The total phenolic contents of the seven Thai medicinal plant extracts were determined using the Folin–Ciocalteu assay by constructing a standard curve of gallic acid. Total phenolic content was the highest in C. sappan extract [mean ± standard error: 220.52 ± 4.47 mM gallic acid equivalent (GAE)/g sample], followed by G. mangostana extract (91.16 ± 4.62 mM GAE/g sample), with the lowest total phenolic content was observed in H. cordata extract (8.51 ± 0.04 mM GAE/g sample) (Table 1).
